p: Their findings are consistent with previous experimental work addressing the strong influence of temperature on the life-history traits of the mosquitoes and arbovirus transmissions [ 9– 12]. Likewise, many existing mechanistic transmission models have integrated the effects of temperature on mosquito traits to understand how it influences the probability and magnitude of dengue transmissions [ 13– 17]. Other recent work examined the influence of seasonal variation in temperature on the epidemic magnitude and duration [ 18, 19]. These models emphasize the strong, nonlinear (often unimodal) influence of temperature and seasonality on dengue transmission and epidemic dynamics.
